cluster_relations.rel_desc: Adult butterflies consume nectar as a food source.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Subject organism consumes the object as a food resource.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The proboscis is used by butterflies to feed on nectar.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Subject structure is used as an instrument by the organism to feed on the object food resource.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Subject anatomical structure is used as an instrument by the organism to feed on a food resource such as nectar.
args.justification: The existing canonical_rel_name 'used_for_feeding_on' is awkward and overly specific to a single food type. Normalizing to 'used_for_feeding' gives a reusable, predicate-style label that still matches the instance semantics (proboscis used to feed on nectar) without baking in the object. The description is updated to stay consistent with the more general predicate while still mentioning nectar as an example. The relation class and group are already appropriate and do not need changes.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: Subject anatomical structure is used as an instrument by the organism to feed on a food resource such as nectar.

Normalizing to 'used_for_feeding' gives a reusable, predicate-style label that still matches the instance semantics (proboscis used to feed on nectar) without baking in the object. The description is updated to stay consistent with the more general predicate while still mentioning nectar as an example. The relation class and group are already appropriate and do not need changes.
